articles.author: Christian Radnedge
articles.title: FA Cup clash features 'Justice League' film fans' push for 'SnyderCut'
articles.description: English soccer fans are used to seeing heroes emerge in the historic FA Cup, but may not often witness the sport cross over with the world of Superman and Batman as it did on Sunday in Tottenham Hotspur's third-round clash with Middlesbrough.
articles.content: LONDON (Reuters) - English soccer fans are used to seeing heroes emerge in the historic FA Cup, but may not often witness the sport cross over with the world of Superman and Batman as it did on Sunday in Tottenham Hotspur’s third-round clash with Middlesbroug… [+2543 chars]

articles.title: Venezuela opposition legislators re-elect Guaido as congress chief
articles.description: Venezuelan opposition legislators on Sunday re-elected Juan Guaido as head of the country's congress in a session held outside the country's legislative palace.
articles.content:
CARACAS (Reuters) - Venezuelan opposition legislators on Sunday re-elected Juan Guaido as head of the country’s congress in a session held outside the country’s legislative palace. 
Hours earlier, the ruling Socialist Party installed a rival lawmaker as cong… [+110 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Thousands rally in New York City against anti-Semitism
articles.description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo and Senator Chuck Schumer were among the thousands who turned out for a march against anti-Semitism after a spate of hate crimes in the region. Lisa Bernhard reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
New York Governor Andrew Cuomo and Senator Chuck Schumer were among the thousands who turned out for a march against anti-Semitism after a spate of hate crimes in the region. Lisa Bernhard reports.

articles.author: Wayne Cole
articles.title: Gold, oil surge in Asia as U.S., Iran exchange threats
articles.description: Asian share markets looked to be heading into turbulence on Monday as a flare-up of tensions in the Middle East sent gold to its highest in almost seven years while oil flirted with four-month peaks.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Asian share markets looked to be heading into turbulence on Monday as a flare-up of tensions in the Middle East sent gold to its highest in almost seven years while oil flirted with four-month peaks.

articles.title: France, Britain, Germany: Iran must refrain from violence and respect nuclear deal
articles.description: The 'E3' group of countries comprised of France, Britain and Germany called on Iran to refrain from any violent action and urged Iran to go back to respecting arrangements laid out in the JCPOA 2015 nuclear deal with world powers.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Rain brings brief respite in Australian bushfire crisis
articles.description: A second day of light rain brought relief for firefighters battling bushfires that have killed 24 people across southeastern Australia, but hot, windy conditions are expected to return later in the week, officials warned on Monday.
articles.content:
MELBOURNE (Reuters) - A second day of light rain brought relief for firefighters battling bushfires that have killed 24 people across southeastern Australia, but hot, windy conditions are expected to return later in the week, officials warned on Monday.

articles.title: Vikings beat Saints in overtime on Cousins touchdown pass
articles.description: Kyle Rudolph caught a four-yard pass from Kirk Cousins in overtime and the Minnesota Vikings upset the New Orleans Saints 26-20 in a NFC wild card playoff game at New Orleans on Sunday.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Kyle Rudolph caught a four-yard pass from Kirk Cousins in overtime and the Minnesota Vikings upset the New Orleans Saints 26-20 in a NFC wild card playoff game at New Orleans on Sunday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Air France plans to run flight schedule on Jan 6-7 despite strikes
articles.description: Air France said on Sunday it planned to run its entire flight schedule on Jan. 6 and Jan. 7, despite calls by some crew unions to strike as part of ongoing nationwide protests over the government's efforts to reform the pension system.
articles.content: PARIS (Reuters) - Air France (AIRF.PA) said on Sunday it planned to run its entire flight schedule on Jan. 6 and Jan. 7, despite calls by some crew unions to strike as part of ongoing nationwide protests over the government’s efforts to reform the pension sys… [+322 chars]

articles.author: Felice Wu
articles.title: Taiwan election is make or break for fleeing Hong Kong protesters
articles.description: A small but growing number of Hong Kong protesters who fled to Taiwan for safety over the past few months fear an opposition victory in the island's election this week will put them in peril and force them to leave.
articles.content:
TAIPEI (Reuters) - A small but growing number of Hong Kong protesters who fled to Taiwan for safety over the past few months fear an opposition victory in the island’s election this week will put them in peril and force them to leave.
